page.title: 01Milton Ernest and Radwell
page.content: {Milton Ernest}is a small village in rural{Bedfordshire.}It is situated six miles North of the county town of {Bedford. The A6 London to Manchester {road}runs from South to Northwest through its centre. The village lies on the northern banks of{The Great {Ouse River.}It has a population of about 650. Radwell is a hamlet on the southern banks of The Great Ouse River lying to the West of Milton Ernest. It has a population of about 100. Compared with a national norm housing is expensive and occupied mainly by business and professional people, many of whom commute to London, and a small aging community of a more traditional village folk. Within this Domesday Block there several small farms, some of which are dairy farms and some are agricultural farms.
